getHardwareResourceByHost

public HardwareResource getHardwareResourceByHost(java.lang.String host)
Returns the hardware resource with a hostname or internet address matching the given string. Returns null if no corresponding hardware resource is found in the resource registry.

Parameters:
host - The hostname or internet address
Returns:
The hardware resource with a hostname or internet address matching the given string

getHardwareResourceByHostName

public HardwareResource getHardwareResourceByHostName(java.lang.String hostName)
Returns the hardware resource with the given hostname. Returns null if no hardware resource exists in the resource registry with the given hostname.

Parameters:
hostName - The hostname
Returns:
The hardware resource with the given hostname

getHardwareResourceByInetAddress

getChildResources

public java.util.List getChildResources(Resource parentResource,
                                        ResourceType resourceType)
A more efficient way to retrieve child resources from a parent resource for any resource that is stored in the database. This is only useful when it is certain the given parent resource is stored in the database and has not been altered by the caller in any way. When in doubt, use the getChildResouces method on the Resoure interface itself.

Parameters:
parentResource - The parent resource
resourceType - The type of child resource to retrieve from the parent resource
Returns:
The list of child resource objects
